intro: Lipotriche australis, commonly known as the Australian starwort, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pinkish blooms. Lipotriche australis is an important component of coastal vegetation, contributing to soil stabilization and habitat for native fauna.
